he: הלכה: בִּשְׁלשָׁה פְּרָקִים בַּשָּׁנָה כוּל׳. אָמַר רִבִּי אַבָּהוּ. כָּל־הֵן דְּתַנִּינָן פַּרְס פַּלְגָא. [פַּלְגָּא בִשְׁלֹשִׁים יוֹם קוֹדֶם לַמּוֹעֵד שֶׁדּוֹרְשִׁין בְּהִלְכוֹתָיו.]

text: HALAKHAH: “Three times a year,” etc. Rebbi Abbahu said, everywhere we have stated pars, it is one half7If no numbers are given, the Latin pars“a part” means one part of two; in this case of the month preceding the holiday.. [Half of the thirty days before a holiday when one explains its rules.8Corrector’s addition from B. Cf. Babli Pesaḥim6b, Megillah4a; Sifry Num. 66.]
